page.title: 13THE SCHOOL AT BRADFIELD
page.content: In 1864 the old school was swept away by the Sheffield Flood.A new school {was built on the present site costing bout Â£800,paid by Sheffield aterworks Company as compensation. When it opened in 1867 there were 45 boys & 18 girls.14 were free scholars. Fees were 3d_4d per week.Free education came in 1891 & in 1901 there were 113 pupils.In 1904 the West Riding County Council became responsible for the school.From 1932 the pupils transferred at the age of 11 to Loxley Council School & the C.of E. School at High Bradfield closed & children attended Low Bradfield School.In 1974 Sheffield Education Department took over the school.Now in July 1985 it is due to close because of low numbers much to the regret of the entire community which fought to keep it open.
